content.raw:
I see--the segfault occurs if the environment variable points to an existing file that does not have the expected format. If `gui::load` returns false, then `gui::run` returns false, which causes gzclient to crash. We may want to address this behavior in a separate pull request. What is the purpose of returning false out of gui::load, and why is the behavior not properly handled?

I updated the behavior in a recent commit.
